definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: Shaoyang will be another new important hub of communications in central Hunan.
sentences.chinese: 邵陽即將成爲湘中腹地新的交通樞紐。
有些人就像這些交通樞紐。

sentences.english: Juyuan Town is the traffic hinge of northwest China and one of materials distributing centers and it is called "East Gate of Dujiangyan City".
sentences.chinese: 公司所處聚源鎮是川西北交通樞紐和物資集散地之一。

sentences.english: The development of modern service industry cluster districts(MSICD) twines together with the growing of the comprehensive transportation hub.
sentences.chinese: 現代服務業集聚區與綜合交通樞紐共生共榮。

sentences.english: Liuzhou is the communication hub in southwest China.
sentences.chinese: 柳州是西南地區的交通樞紐。

sentences.english: The city of Wuhan, where Chen's parents work, is one of the country's busiest train hubs.
sentences.chinese: 陳昱彤的父母在武漢工作，是最繁忙的交通樞紐之一。

sentences.english: Already, Dubai is one of the world's biggest transport hubs.
sentences.chinese: 迪拜早已是全世界最大的交通樞紐之一。

sentences.english: Lastly we describe related issues on transportation organization, environment analysis, and economics of passenger transportation hubs.
sentences.chinese: 繼而圍繞客運交通樞紐這一中心展開交通需求預測。

sentences.english: Next we carry out transportation demand prediction with respect to passenger transportation hub.
sentences.chinese: 繼而圍繞客運交通樞紐這一中心展開交通需求預測。

definition: location/geographical position/position on a grid or spreadsheet, where 區|区 denotes the row and 位 the column
roads open in all directions (idiom); accessible from all sides
along the line (e.g. railway)/the region near the line
Yangtze River Delta/abbr. for 長江三角洲|长江三角洲
(military) strategic town/(fig.) major center (for commerce, culture or tourism etc)
